#summary a helper class to create KernelJAI objects

=KernelFactory=

==Description==

KernelFactory is a class with static methods to make it easier to create KernelJAI objects with a variety of configurations...
 * circle
 * annulus
 * _more coming soon_

==Examples of use==

{{{
/*
 * Create a kernel representing a raster circle
 * with a radius of 3 pixels. The second arg 
 * specifies that elements within the circle will
 * have a value of 1.0 while other elements will
 * be 0.0. The third arg specifies the value of the
 * centre (key) element.
 */
KernelJAI circle = KernelFactory.createCircle(3, Kernel.ValueType.BINARY, 1.0);

// Let's have a look at it...
System.out.println(KernelFactory.kernelToString(circle);
}}}

The call to the kernelToString method will print...

{{{
[[0001000]
 [0111110]
 [0111110]
 [1111111]
 [0111110]
 [0111110]
 [0001000]]
}}}

Creating a kernel for distance-weighted operations...

{{{
/* 
 * Create a kernel representing a raster circle
 * with a radius of 4 pixels. The value of each
 * element in the kernel will be the inverse
 * distance to the kernel centre. The centre
 * element's value is set to 1.0
 */
KernelJAI kernel = KernelFactory.createCircle(4, Kernel.ValueType.INVERSE_DISTANCE, 1.0);


}}}
